result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Defendant Scott A Lemay in court.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Defendant does not have counsel today. 
Defendant does plan to have counsel but cannot afford counsel.  
Defendant would like to complete paperwork for a court appointed attorney. 
State requests bail remain as set. 
Court will take a recess to allow defendant to complete paperwork. 
Matter recalled at 10:29 am   Same appearances. 
Defendant has completed the paperwork.  
Court will approve the petition for court appointed attorney and will order repayment in the amount of  $200.00 per month commencing 11/1/22
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
